1.text: Vinegar is a great alternative if you don’t have club soda.
1.vid: /c/ce/Get Coffee Stains Out of a White Shirt Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4

2.text: Club soda is a quick and easy way to treat minor stains.

3.text: The towel absorbs excess liquid and makes cleaning easier.
3.vid: /4/45/Get Coffee Stains Out of a White Shirt Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4

4.text: Act quickly so the coffee doesn’t have time to soak into the fabric.
4.vid: /7/77/Get Coffee Stains Out of a White Shirt Step 4.360p.mp4

5.text: Rub the detergent into the stain and let it sit for 3-5 minutes.
5.vid: /7/7f/Get Coffee Stains Out of a White Shirt Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4

6.text: Avoid using hot water which could permanently set the stain.

7.text: The heat from your dryer will permanently set a lingering stain.
7.vid: /1/1c/Get Coffee Stains Out of a White Shirt Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4

8.text: Mix the cleaner with warm water and soak the shirt for 30 minutes.
8.vid: /5/59/Get Coffee Stains Out of a White Shirt Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4

9.text: Diluted bleach is safe to use on natural fabrics like cotton and linen.
9.vid: /7/7b/Get Coffee Stains Out of a White Shirt Step 9.360p.mp4
